javadoc:
Panel that contains a DataTree for showing project data.
 Controls whether the data tree supports drag and drop operations.

methods.javadoc:
Construct an empty panel that is going to be used as the active panel
@param plugin front end plugin
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct an empty panel that is going to be used as the active panel

methods.name: <init>

params.name: isActiveProject
params.comment:
true if the project is active, and the
 data tree may be modified

params.name: plugin
params.comment: front end plugin; will be null if the panel is used in a dialog

params.name: filter
params.comment: optional filter that is used to hide programs from view

methods.name: setProjectData
methods.comment:
Set the project data for this data tree and populate it with
 nodes for the users in the project.

params.name: projectData
params.comment: data that has the root folder for the project

methods.javadoc: Close the root folder for this data tree.
methods.name: closeRootFolder
methods.comment: Close the root folder for this data tree.

methods.javadoc:
Select the root data folder (not root node in the tree which
 shows the project name).
methods.name: selectRootDataFolder
methods.comment:
Select the root data folder (not root node in the tree which
 shows the project name).

methods.javadoc:
Set the filter on this data tree.
@param filter determines what should be included in the data tree
methods.name: setDomainFileFilter
methods.comment: Set the filter on this data tree.

params.name: filter
params.comment: determines what should be included in the data tree

methods.javadoc:
Get the number of selected items in the tree.  These could be either files or folders.
@return the number of selected items in the tree.
methods.name: getSelectedItemCount
methods.comment: Get the number of selected items in the tree.  These could be either files or folders.

return.comment: the number of selected items in the tree.

methods.javadoc:
Get the last selected domain folder.
@return null if no domain folder is selected.
methods.name: getSelectedDomainFolder
methods.comment: Get the last selected domain folder.

return.comment: null if no domain folder is selected.

methods.javadoc:
Get the last selected domain file.
@return null if no domain file is selected.
methods.name: getSelectedDomainFile
methods.comment: Get the last selected domain file.

return.comment: null if no domain file is selected.

methods.javadoc: Add the tree selection listener to the data tree. When the listener is notified of the selection change, it should call getSelectedDomainFolder() and getSelectedDomainFile() to get the last selected object. @param l listener to add
methods.name: addTreeSelectionListener
methods.comment:
Add the tree selection listener to the data tree. When the
 listener is notified of the selection change, it should
 call getSelectedDomainFolder() and
 getSelectedDomainFile() to get the last selected
 object.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the tree selection listener from the data tree.
@param l listener to remove
methods.name: removeTreeSelectionListener
methods.comment: Remove the tree selection listener from the data tree.

methods.name: projectRenamed
methods.comment:
Notification that the project was renamed; update the root node name
 and reload the node

methods.name: getActionContext
methods.comment: Get the data tree node that is selected

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider with which to construct the new context

params.name: e
params.comment:
mouse event for the popup; may be null if this is being called as a result of 
        the key binding pressed

return.comment: the new context; null if there is no selection

methods.javadoc:
Adds or removes the filter from the tree.
@param enabled Tree adds the filter; false removes it
methods.name: setTreeFilterEnabled
methods.comment: Adds or removes the filter from the tree.

params.name: enabled
params.comment: Tree adds the filter; false removes it

methods.javadoc: Create the root node for this data tree.
methods.name: createRootNode
methods.comment: Create the root node for this data tree.

methods.javadoc:
Find a node that has the given name and select it.
@param s node name
methods.name: findAndSelect
methods.comment: Find a node that has the given name and select it.

name: ProjectDataTreePanel
comment:
Panel that contains a DataTree for showing project data.
 Controls whether the data tree supports drag and drop operations.
